doc.after: Numerous tools exist for the analysis of the poles of a system These include graphical systems like the root locus Bode plots or the Nyquist plots  Mechanical changes can make equipment and control systems more stable Sailors add ballast to improve the stability of ships Cruise ships use antiroll fins that extend transversely from the side of the ship for perhaps 30 feet 10 m and are continuously rotated about their axes to develop forces that oppose the roll
